poem:
### Scooter Sleuths at Brize Norton

Electric whispers in the night,  
metal birds blush under fleeting spree—  
two vigilant shadows on borrowed breeze,  
gliding through the slumber of wings.  
Silenced sirens in the brisk sweep,  
a trail of paint, a tale untold,  
where scooted phantoms sketch their creed,  
then vanish,  
as if nothing stirred the fold.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pro-Palestine protesters break into RAF base on scooters and deface two aircraft A pro-Palestine protest group has said two of its members broke into the RAF’s Brize Norton airbase and defaced two military aircraft with spray paint before escaping the site without being detained. Palestine Action released a short video on Friday morning showing two people driving electric scooters unimpeded inside the airbase at night, in an embarrassing breach of Ministry of Defence (MoD) security". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Pro-Palestine protesters break into RAF base on scooters and deface two aircraft A pro-Palestine protest group has said two of its members broke into the RAF’s Brize Norton airbase and defaced two military aircraft with spray paint before escaping the site without being detained. Palestine Action released a short video on Friday morning showing two people driving electric scooters unimpeded inside the airbase at night, in an embarrassing breach of Ministry of Defence (MoD) security
